meanings.definition: Greater in size, extent, or importance than others.
meanings.sent1: The elephant is a major animal at the zoo.
meanings.sent2: The earthquake caused major damage to the city.
meanings.sent3: It was a major challenge to climb the steep mountain.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was a major light in the room.
meanings.sent5: The storm brought major destruction to the coastal town.

meanings.definition: A military rank above captain and below lieutenant colonel.
meanings.sent1: The general promoted him to a major in the army.
meanings.sent2: The major led the troops into battle with courage.
meanings.sent3: The major joked with the soldiers during training.
meanings.sent4: His leadership was a major force in the success of the mission.
meanings.sent5: The major's uniform displayed his rank proudly.

meanings.definition: A subject of study chosen as a main field of specialization in college or university.
meanings.sent1: She decided to pursue a major in biology.
meanings.sent2: His major in history required many hours of research.
meanings.sent3: The major in psychology helped her understand human behavior.
meanings.sent4: Choosing a major in art opened up new creative possibilities.
meanings.sent5: Her major in literature inspired a love for storytelling.
